author: chesterbelloc
post: As an unreformed pre VII style Catholic, I can say flat out that Stephen is wrong. Belief in the authenticity of the Shroud(or any relic or apparition) has never been necessary for salvation, even in the Catholic Church. On who is saved, I believe that every person who goes to Heaven gets there from the saving work of Jesus Christ on Calvary, and through the Grace of His Church. How God applies that grace in every circumstance is His business. God is good, God is loving, and God is just. I trust Him with the souls of all people of good will. But hell does exist. Our Lord Himself said so. So we must be prepared to meet Him at our own Judgement, and at the General Judgement at the end of time..
